content.description:
Thoughtful moves, but not necessarily fun. Crux is at the start.

From top left of left-rising dirt ramp, step onto rock and go first diagonal right, next diagonal left, next diagonal right. Then step right 6 feet. Finish straight up.

Untested Variation: Instead of stepping right after the second diagonal right, go diagonal left, then diagonal right, and finish diagonal left - (Untested).

warning

: The rock on and near this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.
content.protection:
Top-Roping: For ideas about how to get access to set up top anchor, see

Description page for Eldorado sector

.

Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
Very big right-facing corner at right edge of slab, which zig-zags as it goes up.

- - >

See on this Photo

content.description:
Very interesting slab climbing, thoughtful exploitation of unexpected features.

Up the crack to its top, then diagonal left to reach left-curving arch. Next step right. Finish straight to the high tree.

warning

: The rock on and near this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.
content.protection:
Top-Roping: For ideas about how to get access to set up top anchor, see

Description page for Eldorado sector

.

Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
At bottom of obvious vertical crack in center of face.

- - >

See on this Photo

content.description:
Upper section is fun (wish it were longer), but start is a bit tricky or a bit awkward.

Up the left side of the boulder, next trend right a bit higher. Next follow cracks diagonal left up through some small bushes -- choose whichever level on the cracks which seems most fun. Finish up to the high tree.

Start Variation: Could also start up behind the right side of the boulder (low class 5).

warning

: The rock on and near this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.

content.description:
Lots of thoughtful moves.

First roughly straight up, then trend a bit left to meet next route to its left, and finish up on that.

warning

: The rock on and near this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.

content.location:
About five feet right down from diagonal left-leaning cracks which are 10-15 right downhill from two slightly left-trending cracks.

- - >

See on this Photo

content.description:
Interesting moves all the way.

Up the twin cracks, then up a bit more diagonal left. Next up trending right to a tooth just above a tree (passing to the left of the 2-3-feet-wide alcove). Stand on top of the tooth, then step up into left-trending crack, reach right to vertical crack, and follow that to top.

Variation (harder): finish up the left-trending crack.

warning

: The rock on and near this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.
content.protection:
Top-Roping: For ideas about how to get access to set up top anchor, see

Description page for Eldorado sector

.

Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
Two left-trending cracks about 8-10 feet right from left edge of face, under a 2-3-feet-wide alcove about 25-30 feet up.

- - >

See on this Photo

content.description:
Lots of interesting moves.

Diagonal left on cracks about fifteen feet or so. Then before reaching the alcove, exit the cracks to right and go roughly straight up, passing through the right end of the right-left zig-zag crack.

Variation 1 (easier): Continue up the double cracks to the 2-3-ft-wide alcove, then follow diagonal crack up right to rejoin main route.

Variation 2 (interesting on TR): When reach the right-left zig-zag crack, go left following the diagonal L-zag crack. Then (with delicacy?) reach left to the vertical crack and step across to the left side of that crack (to join the next route to the right), finish straight up to large tree.

warning

: The rock on and near this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.
